channel.title: Does america have the strongest military
channel.description:
there's more to this than bombs and nukes and crap ...inspired by that stupid beaner topic.
anyway, technique-wise, which country do you think RAEPS?
i personally think finland. their army did amazing in WWII i think or WWI.. just wiki it and you'll find it

item.title: Does america have the strongest military
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“R.I.P RSC, post:169, topic:253262”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=334571.msg3078172#msg3078172 date=1261980133]
The Israeli special forces are not to be taken lightly too.
[/quote]

I’ve heard gas is quite effective on them.[/quote]
Haha, apparently they work with Jews too. But yeah, hand to hand combat, you couldn’t give me all the money in China to try and take one of them on.

Read full topic

item.title: Does america have the strongest military
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Frell, post:162, topic:253262”][quote author=Yz85Racer link=topic=334571.msg3067045#msg3067045 date=1261293234]

[quote]Actually, USA does not have the best “war technology”.

Second off, stop being an ignorant fag.

U.S.A. has held Air superiority for over 50 years. Most unmanned vehicles. Many more reasons really.
By the way nice discussion your reason was “stop being an ignorant fag” . yeah good job you won. lol.

After iraq they are considered a laughing stock.

Took them 2 months to take over Iraq, oh yeah that’s funny…
Laughing stock by who? Maybe the politicians but the marines ?
[/quote]
You do realize there are more Corps of Marines than the U.S Marines? Just they are so publicly hyped it’s so funny. They’re pigs that attend a 6 week basic combat training, and are then shipped off to war. I wonder why they have the highest casualty rate???[quote author=Frell link=topic=334571.msg3066754#msg3066754 date=1261271529]

lol U.S is the best far more advance in technology by years of any country.
Best fighting force the U.S. Marines.

Thats an ignorantly opinionated statement. There is no best force, each force has its own specialty.

In all reality, the debate about the ‘SAS is so awesome’ is dumb. The US and Britian have exchanged exercises and practices between the S.A.S. and SEALs, the majority of what the SAS knows, the SEAL’s do also (and vice versa). It would most likely be a 50/50 fight if such a thing happened.

I don’t just jump into a military debate thread and say that the SEALs would own everyone they’re so talented and no one stands a chance. A couple people have done that here, however.
[/quote]
No they haven’t you moron. The SAS has never trained with other forces than other branches of Special Air Service. i.e the SASR, SAS, FSASR.
[/quote]
Yes, they have. The nations exchange this sort of stuff as a camaraderie, we HAVE sent people to train witht he SAS, they SAS HAS sent people to train with the seals.[/quote]
Where are you pulling this shit from? Are you confused with British Marine Corp? The SAS has never cross trained, other than the branches of itself. Even then, the British Special Air Service has only ever trained with the Special Air Service Regiment of Australia. I don’t think you understand how elite the S.A.S is - they are the epitome of services. The “Navy SEALs”, while excellent counter-terrorism servicemen, do not even compare to them.

If the Navy SEALs were to rage war against the Special Air Service in guerilla warfare, the Special Air Service would make the SEALs look like fools. But if they were doing some form of counter-terrorism boarding of an illegal oil-rig, enemy warship, the Navy SEALs would be in their element.

However, it’s stupid you start to compare the two services. They both wouldn’t ever confront each other, one specializes in force projection from the sea (Marines), one specializes in special reconnaissance missions, and the other is trained in every aspect of warfare, from sniper, survivalist, navigator, hand to hand and the list goes on. Bottom line is, you cannot compare the two.

Read full topic
item.source: Does america have the strongest military

item.title: Does america have the strongest military
item.dc:creator: @R.I.P_RSC R.I.P RSC
item.description:
@R.I.P_RSC wrote:

I believe I’ve said this before, but I’ll say it again. The strength of an army is relative to the enemy. The US defeated the Iraqi army easily, but it can’t defeat some farmers riding donkey’s. You can spend a load on technology, but in guerrilla warfare you can’t use it because the enemy blends in. Nazi Germany had a decent solution for that, but the US can’t do that.

Read full topic
item.source: Does america have the strongest military
